definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
to have a highly retentive memory/to have sth imprinted in one's memory

sentences.english: The leader just skimmed through the headlines of the report.
sentences.chinese: 這位領導只是草草過目了一下那份報告的標題。

sentences.english: Tyler checks out the proposals and throws out any bad ideas.
sentences.chinese: 泰勒會親自過目所有提案，把不順眼的扔出箱子。

sentences.english: You bet it is, but the contrast between the beautiful photography and dog poop is remarkable.
sentences.chinese: 不過美景和狗屎相映成趣倒是讓人過目不忘。

sentences.english: One of the key elements in a memorable photograph may well be the quality of light.
sentences.chinese: 要拍出令人過目難忘的照片，關鍵因素之一是光線。

sentences.english: Please take a brief look at the list of words.
I modified the agreement draft and attached here for you to review.
sentences.chinese: 我修改的合同草案附後，請你過目。

sentences.english: I've already translated thd files, please have a lood.
sentences.chinese: 我已經把這些文件翻譯好了，請過目。

sentences.english: Some work plans or arrangements would be sent to him for approval.
sentences.chinese: 一些工作計劃和安排也要送交他過目批准。

sentences.english: My friend has many talents; one of them is never forgetting a face.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友有很多才能，其中一項就是過目不忘。

sentences.english: Mr Hong, this is the cooperative proposal. Please have a look.
sentences.chinese: 洪先生，這是合作企畫案，請你先過目。

sentences.english: This is our inquiry sheet. Will you like to have a look?
sentences.chinese: 這是我方詢價單，請您過目。

sentences.english: Mr. Emory ? I'd appreciate it if you would look over these letters before you leave today.
sentences.chinese: 埃莫里先生？請您今天走以前過目一下這些信，謝謝。

sentences.english: Therefore the whole text may not into the brain, word for word.
sentences.chinese: 因此可以把整段的文字映入大腦，不必逐字逐句過目。
如果你想要我過目難忘。

sentences.english: Please go over it and see if everything is in order.
sentences.chinese: 請過目一下，看看是否統統妥帖。

definition: to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
lit. slap the table and shout with praise (idiom); fig. wonderful!/amazing!/great!
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
to click one's tongue in wonder (idiom)/to be astonished
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
to have a highly retentive memory/to have sth imprinted in one's memory
